options.content: Maintains confidentiality in verbal communication and with learner records
Maintains confidentially of only records, or only during verbal communication
Does not maintain Confidentiality
Adapts to changes in the routine with no or little reminder/explanation.
Needs multiple reminders to support and adapt to changes in the routine
Does not adapt to changes in routines. Is disruptive to the environment.
Dresses modestly in clean clothes in good repair, & consistent with that of the other professionals in the environment.
Dress not consistent with that of the other professionals in the environment
Dress and/or hygiene is disruptive to the environment
Accepts feedback, acknowledges need for improvement, asks for clarification, and immediately implements recommended changes
Accepts feedback, does not seek clarification, or is delayed in implementing recommended changes
Does not accept feedback, or does not make recommended changes.
Arrives on time and prepared for the session. Notifies provider of any absences.
Attendance: Arrives on time but unprepared
Attendance: Arrives late and unprepared, and/or does not notify cooperating teacher of absences
Exhibits positive and respectful attitude toward providers, families, and other professionals in the environment in verbal and nonverbal communication
Inconsistently exhibits a positive and respectful attitude in verbal or nonverbal communication or across individuals
Uses terms or labels that are disrespectful to individuals, nonverbal communication is disrespectful to individuals in the environment
Takes initiative to improve teaching skills independently and demonstrate this skill across activities
Takes initiative to improve teaching skills only after direction from the teacher, or does not demonstrate across activities
Does not seek opportunities or experiences that with improve teaching skills in the environment
Always clearly state the purpose of the communication interaction (e.g., give information, raise awareness, discuss options, reach a decision)
Sometimes clearly state the purpose of the communication interaction
Rarely clearly state the purpose of the communication interaction
Participates in authentic learning experiences (e.g., practicing, taking risks, making mistakes, trying out new ideas without judgment)
Hesitates to participate in authentic learning experiences
Avoids  participating in authentic learning experiences
Keep an open mind when considering new concepts/ideas and work together to understand (or explain) the "why" and "application" (what's in it for me) behind new learnings
Sometimes keeps an open mind when considering new concepts/ideas
Rarely keeps an open mind when considering new concepts/ideas
Interact with the parents in ways that are sensitive and responsive to the family's unique situation
Sometimes interacts with the parents in ways that are sensitive and responsive to the family's unique situation
Rarely interacts with the parents in ways that are sensitive and responsive to the family's unique situation
Often engages parents through reflective and responsive communication
Sometimes engages parents through reflective and responsive communication
Rarely engages parents through reflective and responsive communication
Always treats family members in ways that are respectful of personal and cultural beliefs and practices
Sometimes treats family members in ways that are respectful of personal and cultural beliefs and practices
Rarely treats family members in ways that are respectful of personal and cultural beliefs and practices
Communicates with all individuals in the environment to coordinate, support and implement intervention. Voice tone is the appropriate volume, natural, and enthusiastic.
Communicates with only some individuals in the room. Voice tone is sometimes the appropriate volume.
Does not communicate with other professionals, or is disruptive to the learning environment
